Terremoto shows the latest earthquake data for the Italian peninsula, as reported by INGV (National Institute of Geophysics and Volcanology). Includes free push notification alerts. Supports Apple Watch. Main features: 
• push notifications on your phone as soon as the event data is available from an official source (you can set alerts based on location and/or magnitude threshold). Push notifications allow the application to receive events even when unused, without this leading to an increased consumption of battery 
• map with different sized and colored circles to represent event magnitude and age 
• event timeline (today, yesterday, previous days) 
• detail view for each event, reachable from map and timeline views 
• magnitude and local (same country) event filters 
• export data to Google Earth or other installed apps supporting kml file format 
• social sharing: share event map and data to Facebook, Twitter, Email 
• reverse geocoding: names of locations, when unavailable, are calculated automatically from their geographical coordinates
• Widgets for your home screen or today view, to keep the latest seismic data at your fingertips
• support for 3D Touch, Haptic Feedback, Critical Alerts, Dark Mode
• Tectonic Plate Boundaries
• Population estimates for each event and Population Density layer (SEDAC)
• extra feature: worldwide events from multiple sources, available as in-app-purchase
• NOAA tsunami bulletins (PRO version only)
• search earthquake events by date, city, country, continent and reporting agency
• Siri Shortcuts support - "Hey Siri, what are the latest earthquakes in Italy?"
• multiple languages: the app is localized in English, Spanish, French, German, Italian

Data source: © ISIDe Working Group (INGV, 2010), Italian Seismological Instrumental and parametric database.
This is an independent app and is not affiliated with or endorsed by INGV.

Meteo 3R riunisce in un’unica applicazione la meteorologia ufficiale del nord-ovest italiano.

Offre la possibilità di consultare le previsioni, i dati osservati e i messaggi di allerta in Piemonte, Valle d’Aosta e Liguria.

Le previsioni sono elaborate e validate da meteorologi esperti e non da algoritmi automatici; anche per questo motivo arrivano al terzo giorno senza spingersi oltre, quando l’affidabilità della previsione cala sensibilmente.

I dati sono in tempo reale, basati sulla più ampia rete pubblica di stazioni meteorologiche tarate e manutenute regolarmente: dalla temperatura alla quantità di pioggia caduta, dalla velocità del vento all’umidità, nell’applicazione sono riportati i principali parametri meteo.

Inoltre è possibile consultare il radar, lo strumento più efficace per seguire lo spostamento delle precipitazioni mentre si stanno sviluppando.

I messaggi di allerta sono quelli ufficiali, emanati per i possibili rischi naturali conseguenti alle condizioni meteo che si potrebbero verificare. Prestare la massima attenzione alle situazioni di potenziale pericolo, adottando le misure di autoprotezione indicate dalla Protezione Civile.

Meteo 3R nasce dalla collaborazione delle 3 regioni - Piemonte, Valle d’Aosta e Liguria - per 3 ragioni  -  osservare, prevedere e allertare.

L’applicazione è stata sviluppata da Arpa Piemonte in cooperazione con il Centro Funzionale della Regione Valle d’Aosta , il Centro Funzionale di Arpa Liguria e il Centro Funzionale di Arpa Piemonte, nell’ambito del progetto RISK-COM, sezione WP4 “Consapevolezza e resilienza” e del progetto RISK-ACT, WP3 - Creazione di una rete di siti pilota transfrontalieri, del Piano Integrato TEMatico RISK.

The app combines highly accurate weather forecast for your location with a 3D map showing development of weather in a broader area in a very interesting way. This allows you to see where precipitation is going to come from or where the wind is blowing from. The uniqueness of the app comes from the amount of data displayed. Forecast of weather, precipitation, wind, cloud cover, atmospheric pressure, snow cover and other meteorological data for different altitudes is available for the whole world. 

WIND ANIMATION
The Ventusky application solves weather displaying in an interesting way. Wind is displayed using streamlines which clearly portray the continuous development of weather. Airflow on Earth is always in motion and the streamlines depict this motion in an amazing way. This makes the interconnection of all atmospheric phenomena obvious.

WEATHER FORECAST
Weather forecast for the first three days is available in the app in one-hour steps. For other days, it’s available in three-hour steps. Users can also look up sunrise and sunrise times in a given place or air quality.

WEATHER MODELS
Thanks to the Ventusky application, visitors get data directly from the numerical models that, just a few years ago, were used solely by meteorologists. The app collects data from the most accurate numerical models. Besides the well-known data from the American GFS and HRRR models, it also displays data from the Canadian GEM model and the German ICON model, which is unique thanks to its high resolution for the whole world. Two models, EURAD and USRAD, are based on current radar and satellite readings. These models are able to show precisely current precipitation in US and Europe.

WEATHER FRONTS
You can also display weather fronts. We have created a neural network that predicts the positions of cold, warm, occluded, and stationary fronts based on data from weather models. This algorithm is unique, and we are the first on the world who makes global fronts forecast available to users.

LIST OF WEATHER LAYERS
• Temperature (16 levels)
• Temperature anomaly
• Perceived temperature
• Precipitation (1 hour, 3 hour, long time accumulation)
• Radar
• Satellite
• Wind gusts (1 hour, long time maximum)
• Air quality (AQI, NO2, SO2, PM10, PM2.5, O3, dust or CO)
• Probability of aurora

summary.label:
Eqforecast is the application that processes the correlations between the forces of gravitational attraction, exerted by the moon and planets, and the historical seismicity data, at a time and in a place indicated by the user (the model is in continuous improvement), identifying earthquakes potentially precursors of stronger and more dangerous earthquakes for human and animal life.

This APP works for Eqs in Italy and, unlike the others on the market, allows you to receive alerts BEFORE the arrival of a strong shock, because it is not based on the detection of the seismic waves just caused by the earthquake that has already occurred, but on astronomical algorithms and known seismic sequences, which normally they anticipate the seismic trigger of the strongest quake.
Several scientific studies have highlighted the possibility that the gravitational attraction (in particular of the Moon and the Sun) can influence the terrestrial tidal forces and the latter earthquakes. The studies of the EqForecast Research Group introduce new elements, for which the action of the 7 planets of the Solar System (with the exception of Pluto) would also have a role in triggering earthquakes.

The App was conceived with a "scientific" spirit. It allows users to verify these studies and to make their own contribution to research on the interpretation and prediction of earthquakes.
The application is not yet a validated model for forecasting earthquakes, which, according to scientists, depend on a complex system of factors, which vary from situation to situation, continuously studied by the scientific community.
 
Once registered and logged in, with the FREE default version the user can view the seismic risk prediction in the 2 dimensions of the seismic risk time and the maximum expected magnitude (Richter) in the App home, but you will not yet be enabled to prediction of the location at risk (possible epicenter), nor upon receipt of sound notifications of pre-seismic alerts.

ALERTS AND LOCATION OF SEISMIC RISK
The functions of receiving pre-seismic sound alerts ("lifesaving" alert) and indicating the potential epicentral location of the future earthquake require the subscription to the BASE or PRO subscription for a fee, but it is possible to take advantage of a trial period of 30 free of charge. days.
The alerts consist of sound notifications directed to your mobile phone which always contain the three dimensions of the seismic risk:
- the "where" (range 30-60 km)
- the "when" (day and time)
- the "how much" (the maximum expected magnitude).

FALSE ALERTS (False positives).
National alert notifications affect a maximum of 5% of the time (therefore in a year at most 18 days) for Mag.> 3.7, of which for the single location the percentage is at most about 50% of that 5%.

THE RELIABILITY OF PRE-SEISMIC ALERTS.
From the experimental evidence, the alerts sent to users located within a radius of 30 km from the epicenter of an earthquake that actually occurred, recorded the following result:
- Eqs minor-ugual M4.1: reliability minor 80%
- Eqs major M4.1: reliability major-ugual 80%

The alert notification generally arrives 1 hour before the expected earthquake, to give the user time to organize the earthquake protection for himself and his family.
These provisions are not intended to replace the CORRECT PREVENTION PRACTICES for oneself and for one's family issued by the relevant government authorities.

THE SCIENTIFIC BASIS OF THE EQFORECAST APP
The scientific basis that informs the model and the App has been stated on several occasions, over time, in a lot of documentation and presentations during some scientific conferences. Texts and interventions are available on the EqForecast website: https://www.earthquakesforecast.com/.

Stefano Calandra.

Barometer Plus app measures air pressure and altitude using your device's built-in barometric pressure sensor.
Because air pressure changes usually indicate a weather change, you can use this app to monitor and predict short-term weather variations.
People suffering from migraine, headaches, or joint pain can monitor how barometric pressure impacts their mood.
Fishermen can monitor the atmospheric pressure for right-time fishing.

FEATURES:
• The app contains a barometer and altimeter with a personalization graphic in classic analog style. It also displays the current temperature and humidity.
• Display barometric pressure (sensor value) or mean sea level pressure (MSLP - value used in weather forecast services or stations).
• Units support for pressure: mb, inHg, kPa, atm, Torr, psi, hPa, mmHg. Units for altitude: meter, feet.
• Calibrate the barometer using altitude/location from the GPS. Calibrate the altimeter using the nearest airport information/METAR, or manually enter the QNH of the nearest airport. Offset sensor output value.
• Measure the height (building/mountain/hiked/climbed) using the "Relative Altitude" feature (can be enabled in the app's Settings).
• Notification about pressure change. "Notification custom rule" for you to define how and when the app sends notifications.
Notify when air pressure changes indicate that extreme or worse weather may occur.
• "Pressure Tracking" and "History Graph" require "Background App Refresh" or "Always Location Service" with "Exact update interval" (paid feature) enabled.
• "My Area" allows you to define your frequent stay places, and the app tracks air pressure with location data.
• Export history to CSV format and Today widget (paid features).
• This app is the digital version compared with an aneroid or mercury barometer and can be adjusted to MSLP with additional features.

CUSTOMIZABLE:
You can change your barometer/altimeter appearance with:
• Seven different housing colors.
• Black, white or blue disk background.
• Four different app backgrounds.
• Three different types of needles.
• Marker needle for easily monitor.
• Dark or light Today widget theme.

NOTES:
• App only works on devices with a barometer sensor, such as iPhone 6/6s/7/8/X/11/12/13 (including Plus models), iPad Mini 4/Air 2/Pro, or later.
• Weather icons on the dial: This only shows the air pressure trend like in an analog barometer.
• Each time your device reboots, open the app for tracking with the "Exact update interval" feature work.
• You may take the phone/tablet far away from computers, cables, and other magnetic sources to get accurate results.
